title: Border Ghost Stories
author: Pease, Howard
snippet: 'Mount again now, my lass,' he added, 'for we ha' crossed the water o'North Tyne, and will win home to the "Bower" cheeks by the gloaming.'

title: Border Ghost Stories
author: Pease, Howard
snippet: He regarded hisproposed son-in-law approvingly, for he was the pure type of North TyneBorderer--of medium stature, but finely formed, with tanned complexion,tawny moustache and ruddy hair, keen blue eye and oval face--mostpleasant to look upon.

title: Border Ghost Stories
author: Pease, Howard
snippet: "So up an' tak wing, my grey-lag goose," he says, "an' wing your waystraight to the North Tyne water."

title: Border Ghost Stories
author: Pease, Howard
snippet: "_Ye'll tak the high road an' I'll tak the low road,_    _An' I'll be in North Tyne afore ye._
